metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7322 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
usersfile.c in liboath in OATH Toolkit before 2.4.1 does not properlyhandle lines containing an invalid one-time-password (OTP) type and a username in /etc/users.oath, which causes the wrong line to be updated wheninvalidating an OTP and allows context-dependent attackers to conductreplay attacks, as demonstrated by a commented out line when usinglibpam-oath.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liboath0 - 2.6.1-1
libpam-oath - 2.6.1-1
oathtool - 2.6.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: oath-toolkit package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.1-1').
